channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Anerley Road SE20 number 137a (boarded, 20th November
item.description:
Anerley Road SE20 number 137a (boarded up ‘kiosk’ facing Anerley Station Road) black boarded up window graffiti tagged and white painted concrete surface under the other boarded up window – black & white paint (or similar) needed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Road, Anerley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A nasty mess dumped, looks like from a house clearance, 20th November
item.description:
This was reported by a neighbour before, council came, left a lot still there. It's all swept into a pile now now but still there. It's very grimy.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sharsted Street, Elephant and Castle, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Wagamama and adjacent Estate Agents, 20th November
item.description:
The paving is very poor, badly broken and uneven. It has been this way ever since I lived here (3 years). I contacted the council and was told works were in hand. Since then TWO slabs have been painted yellow, indicating that they are to be replaced? This is a disaster!! The WHOLE affected area needs to be replaced (please see photos). If this is not dealt with properly, it is an accident waiting to happen. I use a 4 wheel walker and it is very difficult for me to access the restaurant safely.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58-62, Heath Street, Belsize Park, Hampstead, London Borough of Camden
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crystal Palace Parade SE19 diagonall, 20th November
item.description:
Crystal Palace Parade SE19 diagonally opposite side of the road to College Road junction a few yards south is a CCTV camera post which is graffiti tagged. Google Streetview link: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4239929,-0.0760201,3a,75y,141.2h,91.36t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sGdc-AQ9YnD0tNGkAa8aWJQ!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D-1.3550683905533418%26panoid%3DGdc-AQ9YnD0tNGkAa8aWJQ%26yaw%3D141.20387272256994!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MTExNy4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Parade, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling on public bridge, 20th November
item.description:
Dog fouling on public bridge, a big lump is near the middle. Children regularly use this bridge to get to and from school as well as parents with strollers. It is disappointing that even though this bridge had been gritted due to the icy conditions the dog fouling was left there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Forest Road, Slade Green, Erith, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside No. 5 King Henry's Road NW3 3QP, 20th November
item.description:
The parking pole sign was removed when thieves stole my bicycle. This seems to be a preferred technique for bicycle thieves, as the pole is not too high for them to lift the bicycle over the top, having removed the sign. Would it be possible to install a taller parking pole with parking signage so that the bicycle thieves are less inclined to remove both the sign and the bicycle? Thank you so much, Maxine
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, King Henry's Road, Chalk Farm, Hampstead, London Borough of Camden
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Bridge Place, Victoria, City of Westminster

item.title: A large fridge or freezer has been dumped on the pavement together with a table, 20th November
item.description:
A largre fridge or freezer has been dumped on the pavement just outside start of The Limes Close on The Limes Avenue. This was reported on 10 November and it is now accompanied by a pink table. These are obstructing the pavement used by school children who walk along that side. of the road to the primary school. Not good enough! Usually Enfield is much quicker than this at clearing stuff up. Dumping leads to more dumping.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 74, The Limes Avenue, New Southgate, London Borough of Enfield
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light still not working, 20th November
